Articles.Content:
I've done some poking around to see if this is addressed anywhere, and so far I can't find it... please pardon me if I'm repeating a question already answered somewhere else (and, if you could point me to that answer, great)!

 

Building a whole new rocket each time makes sense for the VAB.  They're generally expendable launch vehicles, and with the StageRecovery mod, you can notionally re-use dropped stages calculated to be in good enough shape for re-use.   No worries there.

 

But... cross the tarmac to the SPH, and all of a sudden it's a whole new ball game.   If I go up and do racetracks/touch-and-gos for training on the runway, it doesn't make any sense to "Recover" the plane and then build a whole new one for my next flight...  do I just park it off the runway?   How far off the runway in order to avoid it being "cleaned up?"  And how about refueling... do I need to put in a drill and ISRU to have a fuel tank ready for topping off, or is there a simpler way to do it?   (Am I making this too complicated?   I tend to do that...)

I park just in front of the sph.  As for refueling, I use the claw, it is quite difficult using docking ports.   I successfully used one space plane on 6 different missions by refueling.  On the 7th, the wings would no longer hold on and just kept falling off.  It can be done, you can generate a lot of funds this way, plus the accomplishment of doing it feels so great.  I generally use the island airstrip for these operations and plop a miner over there to gather the fuel required.

When you recover a plane you are getting practically 100% of the funds back except for whatever fuel you used. So there really isn't much of a game play reason to not recover them.

You don't have to think of it as rebuilding the plane each time so much as it's being parked inside somewhere for later use. I think this is really a question of how you are looking at it.

That said, if you just like really parking them outside/refueling them for RP reasons, go right ahead, it's certainly not hurting any thing. To answer your question I find that just off the runway on either side where the incline stops is far enough to not block further launches. the simplest way to refuel them would be to make a "refueling truck" of sorts with a big fuel tank on it and a docking port (The planes will have to have docking ports as well.) or a Klaw. A drill/ISRU setup would certainly be handy but it's not a requirement.

6 minutes ago, Rocket In My Pocket said:

When you recover a plane you are getting practically 100% of the funds back except for whatever fuel you used. So there really isn't much of a game play reason to not recover them.

Ah...  I should point out that I use the Kerbal Construction Time mod, which affects my point of view.   XD    But I see what you're saying.

I don't use that mod, but I was thinking for awhile about doing this sort of thing for RP reasons. I kinda decided that I wanted to make sure that anything "parked" was out of the way of any planes landing on the grass. You only have to move planes a couple meters beyond the sloped parts of the runway to avoid cleanup or "landing strip in use" stuff.

But I decided on the beach area for parking the ISRU, a fuel truck with a klaw to drive between the ISRU and the planes, and all the planes. There are a couple issues regarding spawning pilots and getting them over to the proper plane. So you need a taxi service if you do it that way.

The thing is, though, liquid fuel only costs .8 kredits per unit from the SPH with recovery, and you need a LOT of it to fly around Kerbin. 200 here, 800 there -- and the same again tomorrow. After calculating it out, it seemed like too much of a pain to try to make that much fuel. And then, suddenly, you are all done flying around Kerbin and you don't need any more. So then what do you do with all that infrastructure? Or do you switch to flying SSTO spaceplanes for everything, just because you already are set up to make lots of fuel?
Good questions, to which I don't have a quick answer.   I guess what I was wishing for was the old Microsoft Flight Simulator "Fuel Box" somewhere on the tarmac.

I found drilling better on the island then at ksc.  Until I had my drill rig setup I would just launch a tanker to top off my fuel truck.  There's always flying to be done, you just have to want to do it.
